00001 /**
00002  * @file keys.h
00003  * @date 2007-Dez-11
00004  * @author S. Rohdemann, S.Radtke
00005  * @c (C) 2007 Nanotron Technologies
00006  * @brief Macros for key handling.
00007  *
00008  * @note BuildNumber = "BuildNumber : 7951";
00009  *
00010  * @note This file contains the macros for nanoLOC devkit board
00011  *       for accessing the keys.
00012  */
00013 #ifndef _KEYS_H
00014 #define _KEYS_H
00015 #include "config.h"
00016 #include "ntrxtypes.h"
00017 
00018 extern  volatile bool_t key_flags[];
00019 
00020 #define key_k1()    key_flags[0]
00021 #define key_k2()    key_flags[1]
00022 #define key_k3()    key_flags[2]
00023 
00024 /*available key states*/
00025 
00026 /*NOTE use the define KEY_PRESSED as mask
00027  *to find out if the key is currently pressed
00028  */
00029 #define KEY_NOT_PRESSED         0x00        /*key is currently not pressed*/
00030 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_10MS  0x0A        /*key released after 10 ms .. 1 sec */
00031 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_1S        0x01        /*key released after 1..2 sec*/
00032 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_2S        0x02        /*key released after 2..4 sec*/
00033 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_3S        0x03        /*key released after 4..5 sec*/
00034 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_4S        0x04        /*key released after 5..6 sec*/
00035 #define KEY_REL_AFTER_5S        0x05        /*key released after 6 sec or more*/
00036 
00037 #define KEY_PRESSED                 0x80        /*key is currently pressed*/
00038 #define KEY_PRESSED_FOR_1S  0x81        /*key has been pressed for 1 second (still pressed yet)*/
00039 #define KEY_PRESSED_FOR_2S  0x82        /*key has been pressed for 2 second (still pressed yet)*/
00040 #define KEY_PRESSED_FOR_3S  0x83        /*key has been pressed for 3 second (still pressed yet)*/
00041 #define KEY_PRESSED_FOR_4S  0x84        /*key has been pressed for 4 second (still pressed yet)*/
00042 #define KEY_PRESSED_FOR_5S  0x85        /*key has been pressed for 5 second (still pressed yet)*/
00043 
00044 /**
00045  * @brief Gets the state of the key given by index.
00046  * @param key_index Index number of the key.
00047  * @returns One of the following values will be returned as long as the given
00048  * key is pressed/not pressed:
00049  * <table>
00050  * <tr><td><b>Value</b></td><td><b>Description</b></td></tr>
00051  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_NOT_PRESSED </td><td>if the key is currently not pressed,<td></tr>
00052  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED </td><td>key has been pressed for < 1 sec,</td></tr>
00053  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED_FOR_1S </td><td>if the key has been pressed for 1..2 sec,</td></tr>
00054  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED_FOR_2S </td><td>if the key has been pressed for 2..3 sec,</td></tr>
00055  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED_FOR_3S </td><td>if the key has been pressed for 3..4 sec,</td></tr>
00056  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED_FOR_4S </td><td>if the key has been pressed for 4..5 sec,</td></tr>
00057  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_PRESSED_FOR_5S </td><td>if the key has been pressed for > 5 sec,</td></tr>
00058  * </table>
00059  * There is a special behaviour @em once after key release. The function will
00060  * then return one of these values:
00061  * <table>
00062  * <tr><td><b>Value</b></td><td><b>Description</b></td></tr>
00063  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_10MS </td><td>if the key was released after < 1 sec,<td></tr>
00064  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_1S </td><td>if the key was released after 1..2 sec,</td></tr>
00065  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_2S </td><td>if the key was released after 2..3 sec,</td></tr>
00066  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_3S </td><td>if the key was released after 3..4 sec,</td></tr>
00067  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_4S </td><td>if the key was released after 4..5 sec,</td></tr>
00068  * <tr><td>@ref KEY_REL_AFTER_5S </td><td>if the key was released after > 5 sec,</td></tr>
00069  * </table>
00070  *
00071  * @note To find out if the key is currently pressed this sentence must be true:
00072  * (GetKeyState(mykey) & KEY_PRESSED) == KEY_PRESSED
00073  */
00074 uint8_t GetKeyState(uint8_t key_index);
00075 
00076 #endif  /* _KEYS_H */
